definition: to prepare a dead body for coffin
to put dead body in coffin

sentences.english: Mortuary later picked up 40 people survived Gai, also a Canadian and bandit buried in tombs edge.
sentences.chinese: 後人殮拾40人遺賅時，亦一併將強盜屍首葬於墓邊。

sentences.english: If I do die before thee prithee, shroud me In one of those same sheets.
sentences.chinese: 要是我比你先死，請你就把那些被褥做我的殮衾。

sentences.english: Took the withered and yellow death clothes on the grassland.
sentences.chinese: 將枯黃的殮衣披上草原。

sentences.english: After his death his friends came to lay him out.
sentences.chinese: 他死之後，他的朋友們前來把他殮起來。

sentences.english: The police arrested fifty suspected triad members outside the newly opened Kwai Chung public mortuary .
sentences.chinese: 警方在新建成的葵涌公衆殮房拘捕五十人。

sentences.english: The villagers went to lay out the bodies in the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 村民們前去陳殮戰場上的死屍。

sentences.english: The man's body was wrongly cremated by another family.
sentences.chinese: 死者的遺體被富山殮房弄混，由另一家人錯誤火化。

sentences.english: And Joseph taking the body, wrapped it up in a clean linen cloth.
sentences.chinese: 若瑟領了耶穌的遺體，就用潔白的殮布將它包好。

definition: a funeral/to encoffin a corpse/to carry to burial
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
to reject/to expel/to discard/to exclude/to renounce
to annihilate/abbr. for 殲擊機|歼击机, fighter plane
to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death
